pullRequest.body:
This is exhaustive, with the exception of one goal where the `continuity` proof is seemingly not about continuity at all...
We tag two lemmas with `fun_prop` which were continuity lemmas.

In some cases, this speeds up proofs significantly; we also resolve two porting notes about continuity not applying.


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [8108ce1431](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13959/commits/8108ce1431ecc5a451d74cf1b53a62df22d4d293)

#### Import changes

No significant changes to the import graph

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/24ce5112-25da-4a97-bb3c-1632e586036a) for commit 252d72a5998afc427e1ba8b04776749a72fe4e08.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/406212f1-1ab7-4876-9f3d-7a6fa74518f4/to/24ce5112-25da-4a97-bb3c-1632e586036a) against commit 63b99cae5ea714baa36709508ebea288d715735b:
```diff
  Benchmark                                        Metric         Change
  ======================================================================
+ ~Mathlib.Analysis.Calculus.LineDeriv.Basic       instructions   -30.2%
+ ~Mathlib.Analysis.InnerProductSpace.Projection   instructions    -4.5%
+ ~Mathlib.Analysis.SpecialFunctions.Integrals     instructions   -28.2%
```
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/8be4bbfa-f903-4f9a-96e4-b6a5cc56db58) for commit 18b00efedab0a9a2844b7aebdd529f77eedd2261.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/406212f1-1ab7-4876-9f3d-7a6fa74518f4/to/8be4bbfa-f903-4f9a-96e4-b6a5cc56db58) against commit 63b99cae5ea714baa36709508ebea288d715735b:
```diff
  Benchmark                                                 Metric         Change
  ===============================================================================
+ ~Mathlib.Analysis.Calculus.LineDeriv.Basic                instructions   -30.2%
+ ~Mathlib.Analysis.InnerProductSpace.Projection            instructions    -4.4%
+ ~Mathlib.Analysis.NormedSpace.HahnBanach.SeparatingDual   instructions   -20.3%
+ ~Mathlib.Analysis.NormedSpace.SphereNormEquiv             instructions   -71.9%
+ ~Mathlib.Analysis.SpecialFunctions.Integrals              instructions   -28.2%
+ ~Mathlib.Analysis.SpecialFunctions.Trigonometric.Bounds   instructions   -23.3%
```

Thank you for the review! I have addressed all comments.
awaiting-review

bors r+
Thanks!

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9683370916/job/26718652818)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9683370916/job/26718653064)
Looks great, thanks!
Looks great, thanks!
The output of continuity? looks very unrelated to continuity...
It would be nice to investigate why Continuous.subtype_mk (which is tagged fun_prop) doesn't fire here.

```suggestion
    ¬∑ fun_prop
```
works just fine, right?
Oh, indeed it works here; changed. (It does not work on the next line.)

```suggestion
    ¬∑ simp
```
would make more sense.
All this block can be replaced with just `fun_prop`. Move it even to the `refine` above?
Done, and unindented the refine.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore/perf(Analysis): replace continuity -> fun_prop

source.title: RFC: do not unfold semireducible definitions by default
